revised_title: The Cranial Anatomy and Classification of Lysorophus
tldr: The author examines the structure of Lysorophus, a unique land vertebrate, through the analysis of serial sections. They discuss its classification and its close relationship with Urodeles, a group of amphibians. The study provides insights into the evolution and taxonomy of this remarkable creature, which lived during the Coal Measure times in North America.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Vertebrate Paleontology
